column4: i have rm -rf my apache folders ( was pissin me off) n now i cant apt-get install apache2 :x
you messed with stuff in /usr manually, and now you expect APT to work?
so why didn't you just do "sudo apt-get remove apache2"?
that doesn't mean it didn't remove it. anyway, *what stuff* exactly have you "rm"ed?
nothing else? just /etc/apache2 and /usr/lib/apache2 ?
hold on a moment, i'll try to find out which packages may keep files in there
please type the command at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/43035/plain/ and paste the output into the pastebin
here's the link : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/43037/
you aren't on Gutsy?
that's a problem, since i'm on Gutsy. what are you on?
6.06 lts server edition
then use this command http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/43038/ and give me the output again
i cant see all the output coz its too long.even if i use shit page up
add « | pastebinit -b http://pastebin.com » to the end of that command
pastebinit is not installed and i cant apt-get it :/
oh, perhaps it isn't available in Dapper. then just add « | grep -B 1 "Installed:" » to the end of the command, it should make the output much shorter
: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/43040/
type: sudo apt-get --reinstall install apache2-common libapache2-mod-php5
and then: sudo apt-get --reinstall install apache2

i VERY STRONGLY suggest that you NEVER touch anything in /usr manually again. APT expects it to be its own realm, and all kind of bad things may happen if you don't respect that. everything that is installed in /usr by APT can be *removed* by APT.
try just typing it again
is it still giving you the error even when you try it again?
